title: Rapid strawberry domestication left room to grow
content: The domestication of strawberries (Fragaria x ananassa) stands as an example of remarkable agricultural advancement, with the original hybrids arising less than 300 years ago (Liston et al. 2014). Contrary to what one might expect from a speedy and recent domestication process starting from small founder populations, cultivated strawberries exhibit substantial genetic diversity, attributable to subsequent hybridization events (Hardigan et al. 2021).
